metadata.title: CVE-2021-43389 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.14.15. There is anarray-index-out-of-bounds flaw in the detach_capi_ctr function indrivers/isdn/capi/kcapi.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-43389` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
